result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon R. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA surcharge
--To reimburse $25 buy money (13CF492)
--To reimburse $50 buy money (13CM512)
--To reimburse $100 buy money (14CF76)

5/31/16: Court Orders DNA Surcharge be vacated

--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or any illegal drug
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Random urinalyses at least 2 times per month for the first 6 months of ES, then per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or therapy as per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or incidental contact at work/school or otherwise as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: WWPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 13CF492, Case 13CM512 & Count #2-14CF116 (Walworth County to dismiss this charge)

records.addlTxt:
Cases 13CF492, 13CM512, 14CF76 & 14CF116 (14CF116-Walworth County Case) called together at 9:33 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Brandon R. Smith in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews Defendant's Application for Consolidation; Court approves application for consolidation, presents basis
Service of AMENDED information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1 & Count #2-14CF76; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 13CF492, Case 13CM512 & Count #2-14CF116 (Walworth County to dismiss this charge)

Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Smith to 3 years & 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years. This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being 

Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Smith to 3 years & 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years. This sentence is to commence consecutive to Ct#1

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 148 days credit for time already served. (4/16/14 - 9/11/14)

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision (both cases):
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or any illegal drug
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Random urinalyses at least 2 times per month for the first 6 months of ES, then per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or therapy as per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treament purposes or incidental contact at work/school or otherwise as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To pay costs of $536 ($268 each count)
--To pay $500 DNA Surcharge ($250 each count)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To reimburse $25 drug testing fee (14CF76)
--To reimburse $25 buy money (13CF492)
--To reimburse $50 buy money (13CM512)
--To reimburse $100 buy money (14CF76) 

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Atty Zarwell to submit stipulation regarding remaining credit due, if any 
Recess: 10:09 am
State's signed by Walworth County DA
Defendant's

Cases 14CF76, 13CF492 & 13CM512 called at 1:54 pm
Defendant Brandon R. Smith in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that the Defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Court reviews the Conflict Review Worksheet, Court finds no conflict and signs the Conflict Review Worksheet.

Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.
Attorney Zarwell provides updated address for the Defendant.

On 14CF76:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

On 13CF492:
Court review procedural posture of the case.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court reviews that Judge O'Brien had previously found probable cause in the criminal complaint.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

On 13CM512:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court reviews that Judge O'Brien had previously found probable cause in the criminal complaint.

Court requires $1,000.00 CASH bond to cover all 3 files, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia 

Court will have 13CM512 track with the felony cases, and will not take pleas or address speedy.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Recess: 2:21 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 5/7/14 at 11:00 am
